Package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.modal

Interface Modal

public interface Modal
Represents a modal or dialog window in a UI automation context. Provides methods for checking whether the modal is open, interacting with contained buttons, retrieving textual content, and closing the modal.
Author:
Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    clickButton(SmartWebElement container, String buttonText)
    Clicks a button with the specified text inside a given container.
    void
    clickButton(String buttonText)
    Clicks a button identified by its visible text, without specifying a container.

    Clicks a button identified by a locator.

    Closes or dismisses the modal.

  • Method Details

    • isOpened

      boolean isOpened()
      Checks if the modal is currently open.
      Returns:
      true if the modal is visible/active, otherwise false.

    • clickButton

      void clickButton(SmartWebElement container, String buttonText)
      Clicks a button with the specified text inside a given container.
      Parameters:
      container - the container element within which the button is located.
      buttonText - the visible text of the button to be clicked.

    • clickButton

      void clickButton(String buttonText)
      Clicks a button identified by its visible text, without specifying a container.
      Parameters:
      buttonText - the visible text of the button to be clicked.

    • clickButton

      void clickButton(org.openqa.selenium.By buttonLocator)
      Clicks a button identified by a locator.
      Parameters:
      buttonLocator - the locator referencing the button.

    • getTitle

      String getTitle()
      Retrieves the main title text of the modal.
      Returns:
      the modal's title text, or an empty string if not present.

    • getBodyText

      String getBodyText()
      Retrieves the body text of the modal.
      Returns:
      the main textual content of the modal, or an empty string if not present.

    • getContentTitle

      String getContentTitle()
      Retrieves the content title, which may be separate from the main title, depending on the modal structure.
      Returns:
      the content's title, or an empty string if not present.

    • close

      void close()
      Closes or dismisses the modal.

      Typically performs an action such as clicking a close button or ESC key simulation, depending on the specific modal implementation.
